definition: (like) a cat on a hot tin roof/anxious/agitated
pinyin: re4 guo1 shang5 de5 ma3 yi3

definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: Failing to find her homework, Jill is just like a cat on a hot tin roof.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔的作业找不到了，急得像热锅上的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: He looked like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 他急得像热锅上的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: Ailey nasty like on hot pot ant, in office mad.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉急得如热锅上的蚂蚁，在办公室发疯。

sentences.english: He is as nervous as a cat on a hot roof.
sentences.chinese: 他紧张的像一只热锅上的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: He was so worried that he looked like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 他焦急如焚，就象热锅上的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: What's wrong with you? You look like a cat on hot bricks.
sentences.chinese: 你怎么了？你看上去就像是热锅上的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: He was like a cat in hot bricks before his driving test.
sentences.chinese: 在他考驾驶考试前他就像热锅上的蚂蚁那样紧张。

definition: see 無頭蒼蠅|无头苍蝇[wu2 tou2 cang1 ying5]
headless fly (a metaphor for sb who is rushing around frantically)
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
